citation.article-title: Skermanella aerolata sp. nov., isolated from air, and emended description of the genus Skermanella
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Skermanella aerolata sp. nov.
Skermanella aerolata (ae.ro.la′ta. Gr. n. aer air; L. part. adj. lata carried; N.L. part. adj. aerolata airborne).
Cells are strictly aerobic, Gram-negative rods, and motile by means of a single polar or subpolar flagellum.
Growth occurs with NaCl concentrations in the range 0–5 % and at pH 4–9.
Positive for catalase, oxidase and hydrolysis of CM-cellulose, starch and Tween 80.
Negative for Voges–Proskauer test, for the deamination of phenylalanine and for hydrolysis of casein, chitin, DNA, pectin and tyrosine.

Ferments d-arabinose, l-arabinose, d-ribose, d-xylose, l-xylose, d-galactose, d-glucose, d-melibiose and d-lyxose, but does not ferment glycerol, erythritol, d-adonitol, methyl β-d-xylopyranoside, d-fructose, d-mannose, l-sorbose, l-rhamnose, dulcitol, inositol, d-mannitol, d-sorbitol, methyl α-d-mannopyranoside, methyl α-d-glucopyranoside, N-acetylglucosamine, amygdalin, arbutin, aesculin, salicin, d-cellobiose, d-maltose, d-lactose, d-sucrose, d-trehalose, inulin, d-melezitose, d-raffinose, starch, glycogen, xylitol, gentiobiose, d-turanose, d-tagatose, d-fucose, l-fucose, d-arabitol, l-arabitol, potassium gluconate, potassium 2-ketogluconate or potassium 5-ketogluconate (API 50 CH strips).
Major respiratory lipoquinones are Q-10 and Q-8.
Major fatty acids are C18 : 1ω7c and C16 : 0.
The G+C content of the genomic DNA of the type strain is 65.0 mol%.
The type strain, 5416T-32T (=KACC 11604T=DSM 18479T), was isolated from air in Taean, Republic of Korea.
